title: Ticket #2458: Coverity of IPv6 code
description:
Status: I believe all real IPv6 bugs are resolved. There are a few the ("INSANE") bugs that should get a second opinion. The remaining "probably not ipv6" should also get re-reviewed; if really not IPv6, copy over to #2473.

Bug states:

  • not ipv6 - Probably a real bug, but not related to IPv6 work. Ignoring for now
  • BUG - Real bug, not yet resolved
  • fixed - Real bug, fixed
  • not bug - Not a bug, works as intended.
  • INSANE - Coverity has apparently gone insane. Recheck with second pair of eyes

  • 11057 fixed... UNINIT - 2e67823
  • 11056 fixed... UNINIT - 11f588cbc6a205f161b1c4185057ef0719f496f9
  • 11048 fixed... CHECKED_RETURN f0342de
  • 11039 fixed... UNINIT 271ba9d
  • 11011 okay.... PASS_BY_VALUE - Valid, efficiency warning
  • 11022 INSANE.. RETURN_LOCAL
  • 10992 INSANE.. FORWARD_NULL - "At conditional (4): "status != 0" taking the false branch." appears wrong; it must be true given what happened at and around "At conditional (2): "*__errno_location() == 2" taking the true branch."
  • 10988 not bug. DEADCODE - Coverity isn't aware of #ifdef magic.
  • 10987 INSANE.. DEADCODE - Why can't spin_pie increment to larger numbers?
  • 10986 INSANE.. DEADCODE
  • 10966 ........ UNINIT
  • 10996 ........ FORWARD_NULL - probably not ipv6
  • 10995 ........ FORWARD_NULL - probably not ipv6
  • 10994 ........ FORWARD_NULL - probably not ipv6
  • 10993 ........ FORWARD_NULL - probably not ipv6
  • 10976 ........ CHECKED_RETURN - probably not ipv6
  • 10963 ........ OVERRUN_STATIC - probably not ipv6
  • 10962 ........ OVERRUN_STATIC - probably not ipv6

Not IPv6 problems, but may be real problems. Worth looking into later. Bugs with some work done have been moved over to #2473. Bugs with none are being ignored; they should show up on future investigations

  • 11055 not ipv6 REVERSE_INULL
  • 11054 not ipv6 REVERSE_INULL
  • 11053 not ipv6 RESOURCE_LEAK - May not be a real bug, requires closer reading.
  • 11052 not ipv6 NEGATIVE_RETURNS
  • 11051 not ipv6 NEGATIVE_RETURNS
  • 11049 not ipv6 CHECKED_RETURN
  • 11046 not ipv6 UNINIT_CTOR
  • 11045 not ipv6 UNINIT_CTOR
  • 11041 not ipv6 UNINIT_CTOR
  • 11040 not ipv6 UNINIT_CTOR
  • 11038 not ipv6 UNINIT
  • 11037 not ipv6 UNINIT
  • 11034 not ipv6 UNINIT
  • 11032 not ipv6 UNINIT
  • 11029 not ipv6 UNINIT
  • 11026 not ipv6 UNINIT
  • 11058 not ipv6 UNINIT - Globus related
  • 11024 not ipv6 REVERSE_INULL - Possibly INSANE
  • 11019 not ipv6 RESOURCE_LEAK - Appear real, if rare.
  • 11018 not ipv6 RESOURCE_LEAK - WILL LEAK
  • 11017 not ipv6 RESOURCE_LEAK - may leak
  • 11016 not ipv6 RESOURCE_LEAK - WILL LEAK; strdup is wrong. While we're at it, refactor to use two argument form of SetEnv. See if we can eliminate the single argument form?
  • 11015 not ipv6 RESOURCE_LEAK - WILL LEAK
  • 11014 not ipv6 RESOURCE_LEAK - WILL LEAK
  • 11013 not ipv6 RESOURCE_LEAK - WILL LEAK if execvp fails.
  • 11012 not ipv6 RESOURCE_LEAK - maybe leaks
  • 11010 not ipv6 NEGATIVE_RETURNS - Probably wrong, should check if socket() failed
  • 11007 not ipv6 MISSING_RETURN - wrong
  • 11006 not ipv6 MISSING_BREAK - Needs investigation to understand intent
  • 11002 not ipv6 FORWARD_NULL
  • 11001 not ipv6 FORWARD_NULL
  • 11000 not ipv6 FORWARD_NULL
  • 10999 not ipv6 FORWARD_NULL
  • 10998 not ipv6 FORWARD_NULL
  • 10997 not ipv6 FORWARD_NULL
  • 10985 not ipv6 CONSTANT_EXPRESSION_RESULT - Probably DEADCODE
  • 10984 not ipv6 CONSTANT_EXPRESSION_RESULT - Probably DEADCODE
  • 10983 not ipv6 CONSTANT_EXPRESSION_RESULT - Probably DEADCODE
  • 10982 not ipv6 CHECKED_RETURN
  • 10981 not ipv6 CHECKED_RETURN
  • 10980 not ipv6 CHECKED_RETURN
  • 10979 not ipv6 CHECKED_RETURN
  • 10978 not ipv6 CHECKED_RETURN
  • 10977 not ipv6 CHECKED_RETURN
  • 10975 not ipv6 CHECKED_RETURN
  • 10973 not ipv6 CHECKED_RETURN
  • 10972 not ipv6 CHECKED_RETURN
  • 10971 not ipv6 CHECKED_RETURN
  • 10970 not ipv6 CHECKED_RETURN

Bad calls on Coverity's part:

  • 11035 not bug. UNINIT
  • 11033 not bug. UNINIT
  • 11031 not bug. UNINIT - decode/code
  • 11030 not bug. UNINIT - decode/code
  • 11028 not bug. UNINIT - decode/code
  • 11027 not bug. UNINIT - decode/code
  • 11025 not bug. UNINIT
  • 11021 not bug. RESOURCE_LEAK - Coverity didn't understand callback handler
  • 11020 not bug. RESOURCE_LEAK - Coverity didn't understand callback handler
remarks:
2012-Jul-16 13:46:00 by adesmet:
Old. Important stuff done. Resolving.
check_ins:
2011-Sep-14 16:35   Check-in [27220]: Fix very confused logic finding hostname of incoming connection. Fixes coverity 11057 ===GT=== #2458 (By Alan De Smet )
2011-Sep-13 17:09   Check-in [27219]: Cover make condor_getostaddr_ipv6 robust in face of invalid input. Coverity 11039. ===GT=== #2458 (By Alan De Smet )
2011-Sep-13 16:01   Check-in [27218]: Verify that we could parse IP address in the CKPT_SERVER_HOSTS list, EXCEPTing on failure. Fixes Coverity 11048. ===GT=== #2458 (By Alan De Smet )
